header.title: Knowledge
header.subtitle: Create, import, and organise your strands. Build your weave over time.

preferences.title: PKMS Preferences
preferences.subtitle: Configure autosave and background metadata generation for the composer.

review.title: Review suggestions
review.subtitle: Select which tags and backlinks to apply to your strand.

empty.title: No strands yet
empty.description: Get started by creating a note with the composer, using a template, or importing content.

welcome.title: Welcome to OpenStrand PKMS
welcome.description: Build and navigate your knowledge with strands, templates, and an intelligent weave.

templates.title: Templates
templates.subtitle: Start faster with a structured template. You can customise everything later.

zettelkasten.name: Zettelkasten Note
zettelkasten.description: Atomic note with clear idea, context, and links. Great for interconnected thinking.

researchSummary.name: Research Summary
researchSummary.description: Summarize papers, docs, or findings with highlights, questions, and next steps.

projectBrief.name: Project Brief
projectBrief.description: A crisp project brief with scope, objectives, deliverables, timeline, and stakeholders.

meetingNotes.name: Meeting Notes
meetingNotes.description: Structured notes for meetings with attendees, agenda, decisions, and action items.

viz.title: Inline visualization
viz.subtitle: Preview a chart from CSV/JSON and attach as an image while saving JSON config into metadata.

data.title: Data
data.hint: CSV columns: label,value. Or switch to JSON to provide full config/data.
data.help: Paste small CSV data (label,value) or provide JSON with { config, data } to render.

preview.empty: Your visualization preview will appear here.

help.title: PKMS Help
help.subtitle: Short guides, tips, and links for new users.

content.overview: The PKMS dashboard lets you create notes (strands), use templates, and import content.
content.creator: Use the Creator to write and format notes; metadata like note type and tags help organisation.
content.templates: Kick off with a template to structure your thoughts quickly and consistently.
content.import: Bring in files, media, or datasets. We capture metadata and summaries where possible.
content.tips: Explore tutorials and documentation to get the most out of OpenStrand.

quickCapture.pastePH: Paste text to quickly create a strand…
